graph_title: Share of poor population who receive family benefit
indicator_name: Share of poor population who receive family benefit
national_indicator_description: This indicator is the ratio of family benefit recipients to the total number of vulnerable people. The latter is calculated by subtracting from the total population all persons of working age who are included in the social insurance system or receive benefits, as well as all persons of retirement age who also receive benefits.
computation_definitions: State benefit is a regular or one-time financial assistance provided from the state budget.
computation_calculations: The ratio of the poor receiving to the total number of poor.
comments_limitations: The main source of information is an Integrated Living Conditions Survey (ILCS) (https://www.armstat.am/en/?nid=82&id=2217).
source_organisation_2: Integrated Living Conditions Survey of households (ILCS)
